(40) 408.October 8, 1940./TO BE KEPT UNDER LOCK AND KEY.It is requested that special care may be taken toensure the secrecy of this document.WAR CABINET.LOSS OF WORKING TIME DUE TO AIR RAID WARNINGS.Note by the Secretary.THE appended Memoranda by the Minister of Aircraft Production are circulated by direction of the Prime Minister.(Signed) E. E. BRIDGES,Secretary.Memorandum by the Minister of Aircraft Production.The country waits on a declaration now in terms that will persuade the mento stay at their benches.The siren is still the signal for laying down tools in most places.The issue involved is bigger than any other domestic question and requiresimmediate and vigorous treatment.B.Ministry of Aircraft Production,October 8, 1940.Memorandum by the Minister of Aircraft Production.For the week ending the 28th September : Airspeed lost one-third of their total working time.Bristol lost one-sixth of their time.De Havilland were out more than half of their working time.Fairey, Hayes, out about half total time.Hawker, Kingston, also half total time.Percival, Luton, just less than half their time.Rootes of Speke half their time.Saunders Roe, Isle of Wight, the same.Shorts, Rochester, out more than half time.Supermarine out over one-third of their time.Chester out one-fifth total time.These are the highest totals. It will be seen that most of the factories arein London or in the south of the country.The accessories factories, equally important, show the same unsatisfactorycondition.B.Ministry of Aircraft Production,October 8, 1940.[21809]
